The applicant's age should be between 18 to 50 years. The applicant must have knowledge of the business for which they are applying for a loan. The applicant must have her own name, or joint name with her husband, or her husband’s name (with affidavit) on the 7/12 land extract for agricultural project loans. For the 50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money, her annual income must be below the poverty line. For the NSFDC Scheme, the income limit is ₹98,000 for rural areas and ₹1,20,000 for urban areas.
Application Process: Offline. Step 1: Visit the District Office of Leather Industries Development Corporation of Maharashtra (LIDCOM) to request the application form. Step 2: Fill the form, attach passport-size photo and required documents. Step 3: Submit the filled application with documents to LIDCOM District Office. Step 4: Acquire receipt/acknowledgement with date, time, and unique ID.
Documents Required: Completed application form from LIDCOM District Office. Recent passport-size photograph. Valid Income Certificate. Caste Certificate (Charmakar Community). Proof of Residence (Maharashtra). 7/12 Land Extract. Knowledge or experience proof relevant to the proposed business/project.

Scheme Name: Savitribai Phule Scholarship For V.J.N.T. And S.B.C. Girl Students Studying In 5th To 7th Standard
Details: Savitribai Phule Scholarship is a Scholarship Scheme by the Social Justice and Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra. The scheme was introduced 12th January 1996 and amended on 29th October 1996 to include S.B.C. Students. The objective is to encourage enrollment and reduce dropout of girl students from Vimukta Jati and Nomadic Tribes (VJNT) and Special Backward Classes (SBC) studying in Class 5th to 7th. Beneficiary receives ₹60 per month, ₹600 for ten months.
Benefits: ₹60 per month; ₹600 for ten months
Eligibility: Applicant must be a girl. Applicant must be a resident of Maharashtra. Applicant must belong to Vimukta Jati and Nomadic Tribes (VJNT) or Special Backward Classes (SBC). Applicant must be studying in Class 5th to 7th in a Government Recognized School.
Application Process: Online. Step 1: Visit Aaple Sarkar / Maha DBT. Step 2: Register as a new applicant. Step 3: Login to MahaDBT, link Aadhaar with Bank. Step 4: Fill profile and upload documents. Step 5: Select Savitribai Phule Scholarship from 'All Schemes'. Step 6: Fill additional info, upload documents, submit and save Application ID. Track status via 'My Applied Scheme History'.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Proof of Identity; Proof of Age (Birth Certificate); Proof of Address; Domicile Certificate of Maharashtra; Caste Certificate VJNT or SBC; Marksheet of Latest Educational Qualification; Fee Receipt of Current Course Year; Bank Account Details; Passport-sized Photograph

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance To Disabled For Self Employment
Details: The 'Financial Assistance to Disabled for Self Employment' is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra. The objective is to facilitate self-employment of unemployed disabled persons by providing financial support for self-employment, small-scale business, and agro-based projects. The scheme is 100% funded by the Government of Maharashtra.
Benefits: Financial Assistance up to ₹1,50,000/- is provided. 80% loan amount by Nationalized Bank and 20% subsidy (up to ₹30,000/-) by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance.
Eligibility: Applicant must be a citizen of India and a permanent resident of Maharashtra. Applicant must be a Person with Disability (Visually Handicapped, Low Vision, Hearing Impaired, Orthopedically Handicapped, etc.) with 40% or more disability. Age must be between 18–50 years. Annual income should be less than ₹1,00,000/-.
Application Process: Offline. Step 1: Visit District Social Welfare Office and request the application form. Step 2: Fill all mandatory fields, attach documents and photographs. Step 3: Submit to Assistant Commissioner, District Social Welfare Office. Step 4: Obtain receipt/acknowledgment for submission.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age (Birth Certificate, Marksheet, etc.); 2 Passport-sized Photographs (signed across); Residential/Domicile Certificate of Maharashtra; Disability Certificate; Income Certificate; Bank Account Details; Any other document required by the District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Special Education And Vocational Training Through Government Institutions
Details: The 'Special Education and Vocational Training through Government Institutions' scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra provides special education for children with disabilities (6–18 years) and vocational training for those above 18 years. It is 100% funded by the state government.
Benefits: Free education for children with disabilities till 18 years; Vocational training for special children above 18 years; Free facilities of food, shelter, clothing, and education.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen and a permanent resident of Maharashtra. Must be a Person with Disability (Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired, Orthopedically Handicapped, etc.) with 40% or more disability. For education: 6–18 years; for vocational training: above 18 years.
Application Process: Offline. Step 1: Visit District Social Welfare Office and collect the application form. Step 2: Fill details, attach documents, and submit to Assistant Commissioner, District Social Welfare Office. Step 3: Obtain receipt of submission.
Documents Required: Proof of enrollment into Government Institution; Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age (Birth Certificate/Marksheet); 2 Passport-sized Photographs (signed across); Residential/Domicile Certificate of Maharashtra; Disability Certificate; Bank Account Details; Any other required document.

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance For Aids And Appliances For Disabled Persons
Details: The 'Financial Assistance for Aids and Appliances for Disabled Persons' is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra. It provides assistance to Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) for purchasing aids and appliances suitable to their age and type of disability. It is fully funded by the Government of Maharashtra.
Benefits: Hearing Handicapped: Hearing Aids; Orthopedically Handicapped: Crutches, Tricycles, Calipers, Wheelchairs; Visually Handicapped: Tape Recorders and Blank Cassettes up to ₹3,000 for education.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen and a permanent resident of Maharashtra. Must be a Person with Disability (Visually Handicapped, Low Vision, Hearing Impaired, Orthopedically Handicapped, etc.) with 40% or more disability. For 100% cost aid: income < ₹1,500/month; for 50% cost aid: income between ₹1,500–₹2,000/month.
Application Process: Offline. Step 1: Visit District Social Welfare Office and request the application form. Step 2: Fill details, attach documents, and submit to Assistant Commissioner, District Social Welfare Office. Step 3: Obtain receipt for submission.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age (Birth Certificate, Marksheet, etc.); 2 Passport-sized Photographs (signed across); Residential/Domicile Certificate of Maharashtra; Disability Certificate; Bank Account Details; Any other document required by the District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Maintenance Allowance To VJNT And SBC Students Studying In Professional Courses And Living In Hostel Attached To Professional Colleges
Details: The Government of Maharashtra introduced this scheme to support VJNT and SBC students pursuing professional courses (Medical, Engineering, Animal Husbandry, etc.) by providing maintenance allowance through their respective colleges.
Benefits: For 4 to 5 year courses (Medical, Engineering, Agriculture, etc.): ₹700/month; For 2–3 year courses (Engineering Diploma, MBA, MSW, etc.): ₹500/month; For 2-year or shorter courses (B.Ed., D.Ed.): ₹500/month for 10 months.
Eligibility: Applicant must belong to VJNT or SBC category. Must be studying in a professional course such as Medical, Engineering, Animal Husbandry, etc. Must have applied for admission in a Government or approved private hostel.
Application Process: Online. Step 1: Register as new applicant on MahaDBT website. Step 2: Login, fill personal details, and create profile. Step 3: Apply for eligible scheme and upload documents. Applications are forwarded by colleges to Assistant Commissioner, Social Welfare.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Domicile Certificate; Caste Certificate (VJNT/SBC); Family Income Certificate; Latest Marksheet; Bank Account Details; Passport-sized Photograph.

Scheme Name: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)
Details: The 'Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)' by the Social Justice & Special Assistance Department provides monthly pensions to differently-abled individuals aged 18–65 years with 80% or higher disability.
Benefits: ₹600 monthly pension to eligible differently-abled individuals.
Eligibility: Applicant must be a resident of Maharashtra, aged between 18 and 65 years, with 80% or more disability. Must not receive any other social security pension.
Application Process: Offline. Step 1: Visit the Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi during office hours to collect the form. Step 2: Fill details, attach documents, and submit within prescribed period. Step 3: Obtain acknowledgment with submission details.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; Passport-size Photograph; Identity Proof (Voter ID/Driving License); Disability Certificate; Proof of Age; Caste Certificate (if applicable); Address Proof; Bank Passbook/Account Details; Any other required documents.

Scheme Name: Yashwantrao Chavan Mukta Vasahat Yojana for VJNTs
Details: The 'Yashwantrao Chavan Mukta Vasahat Yojana for VJNTs' is launched by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra. It aims to enhance the quality of life of Vimukta Jati and Nomadic Tribe (VJNT) families by developing sustainable income sources and promoting economic stability. Each family receives a 5-guntha plot (approx. 500 sq.m or 5,382 sq.ft) including a 269 sq.ft home as part of the assistance.
Benefits: Each family receives a 5-guntha plot with a 269 sq.ft home; cluster of 20 families per project; includes essential amenities like roads, drainage, water, electricity, and a community hall; benefit extended to 3 villages per year in 34 districts (excluding Mumbai & B. Mumbai); land given jointly to husband and wife (or solely to widows/divorcees); land is non-transferable and cannot be rented or sold.
Eligibility: Applicant family must reside in Maharashtra; belong to VJNT (Vimukta Jati & Nomadic Tribes); must not own a house; must be landless and living in tent/hut; must reside at one place for 6 months and migrate for livelihood for the rest; annual income below ₹1,00,000; must not have availed benefits of other housing schemes (e.g., Gharkul); only one family member eligible; priority to widows, divorcees, handicapped, flood-affected, and families living in tents.
Application Process: Offline: Visit Office of the Assistant Commissioner of Social Welfare of the concerned district; collect prescribed application form; fill details, attach documents, and submit to the office staff.
Documents Required: Identity proof (Aadhaar, Voter ID, etc.); passport-size photograph; VJNT category certificate; domicile/address proof; bank account details; income certificate issued by government officer; declaration of landlessness.

Scheme Name: Savitribai Phule Scholarship For V.J.N.T. And S.B.C. Girl Students Studying In 5th To 7th Standard
Details: Savitribai Phule Scholarship is a Scholarship Scheme by the Social Justice and Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra. The scheme was introduced on 12th January 1996 and amended on 29th October 1996 to include S.B.C. students. The objective of the scheme is to encourage enrollment and reduce dropout ratio of girl students of Maharashtra from Vimukta Jati and Nomadic Tribes (VJNT) and Special Backward Classes (SBC), studying in Class 5th to 7th.
Benefits: The beneficiary is provided ₹60 per month, i.e. ₹600 for ten months.
Eligibility: Applicant must be a girl; must be a resident of Maharashtra; must belong to VJNT or SBC category; must be studying in Class 5th to 7th; must be enrolled in a government-recognized school.
Application Process: Online: Visit Aaple Sarkar/MahaDBT website → Register as a new applicant → Verify mobile & email → Login to MahaDBT portal → Complete Aadhaar-bank link and profile → Select 'Savitribai Phule Scholarship' under 'All Schemes' → Fill in required information, upload documents, and submit → Save Application ID for reference.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Proof of Identity; Proof of Age (Birth Certificate); Proof of Address; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; Caste Certificate (VJNT/SBC signed by Tehsildar or above); Latest Educational Qualification Marksheet; Current Year Fee Receipt; Bank Account Details; Passport-size Photograph.

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance To Disabled For Self Employment
Details: The 'Financial Assistance to Disabled for Self Employment' is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra. The objective of this scheme is to facilitate the self-employment of unemployed disabled persons. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to persons with disabilities for self-employment, small-scale business, and agro-based projects. Only citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply for this scheme. This scheme is 100% funded by the Government of Maharashtra.
Benefits: Financial assistance up to ₹1,50,000/- is provided. 80% of the loan amount is provided by the Nationalized Bank. 20% subsidy of up to ₹30,000/- is provided by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen; must be a permanent resident of Maharashtra; must be a Person with Disability (Visually Handicapped, Low Vision, Hearing Impaired, Orthopedically Handicapped, etc.); disability percentage must be 40% or above; must be aged between 18–50 years; annual income must be below ₹1,00,000/-.
Application Process: Offline: Visit the District Social Welfare Office → Request application form → Fill and sign with photograph → Attach self-attested mandatory documents → Submit to the Assistant Commissioner, District Social Welfare Office → Collect acknowledgement receipt upon submission.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age (Birth Certificate, Class 10th/12th Marksheet, etc.); Two passport-sized photographs (signed across); Residential/Domicile Certificate of Maharashtra; Disability Certificate; Income Certificate; Bank Account Details (Bank Name, Branch, Address, IFSC, etc.); Any other document required by the District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Special Education And Vocational Training Through Government Institutions
Details: The 'Special Education and Vocational Training through Government Institutions' is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra. Under this scheme, special education is provided to children with disabilities aged 6 to 18 years in Government Special Schools, and vocational training is provided to special children above 18 years of age. Only citizens who are permanent residents of Maharashtra are eligible. This scheme is 100% funded by the Government of Maharashtra.
Benefits: Free special education is provided up to the age of 18 years; special children above 18 years receive vocational training; free facilities of food, shelter, clothing, and education are provided in these institutions.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen; permanent resident of Maharashtra; Person with Disability (Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired, Orthopedically Handicapped, etc.); disability percentage 40% or above; age 6–18 years for Special Education; 18 years and above for Vocational Training.
Application Process: Offline: Visit District Social Welfare Office → Request application form → Fill and attach required documents → Submit to Assistant Commissioner, District Social Welfare Office → Collect acknowledgment of submission.
Documents Required: Proof of Enrollment into Government Institution; Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age (Birth Certificate, Class 10th/12th Marksheet, etc.); Two passport-sized photographs (signed across); Residential/Domicile Certificate of Maharashtra; Disability Certificate; Bank Account Details (Bank Name, Branch, Address, IFSC, etc.); Any other document required by the District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Ramai Awas (Gharkul) Scheme for SC & Nav-Buddha (Urban and Rural)
Details: The scheme 'Ramai Awas (Gharkul) Scheme for SC & Nav-Buddha (Urban and Rural)' is a housing initiative by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra. It aims to raise the standard of living of individuals from the Scheduled Caste and Nav-Buddha communities residing in rural and urban areas of Maharashtra.
Benefits: Rural Area: ₹1,00,000/- (Beneficiary's share: Nil); Municipal Area: ₹1,50,000/- (Beneficiary's share: 7.5%); Municipal Corporation: ₹2,00,000/- (Beneficiary's share: 10%).
Eligibility: 1. Applicant must have lived in Maharashtra for at least 15 years. 2. Annual income limits: Rural – ₹1,00,000/-, Municipal Area – ₹1,50,000/-, Municipal Corporation – ₹2,00,000/-. 3. Only one person per family can receive the benefit. 4. Applicant must own land. 5. Applicant should not be receiving benefits from any other housing scheme. Priority is given to Below Poverty Line (BPL) applicants.
Application Process: Online: Step 1 – Visit one of the following offices during working hours to collect the application form: Assistant Commissioner, Social Welfare Office; Project Director, District Rural Development Agency; District Council / Municipal Commissioner. Step 2 – Fill in all required fields, attach passport photo and self-attested copies of mandatory documents. Step 3 – Submit the filled form with documents to the concerned authority within the prescribed period. Step 4 – Collect receipt or acknowledgment with date, time, and submission ID.
Documents Required: Residential/Domicile Certificate; Caste Certificate; Aadhaar Card; Address Proof; Identity Card; Passport-size Photograph.

Scheme Name: Karma Veer Dadasaheb Gaikwad Sabalikaran & Swabhiman Yojana
Details: A financial assistance scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra to improve the economic condition of landless Scheduled Castes and Nav-Buddhists from Below Poverty Line families. The scheme is 100% state funded.
Benefits: Beneficiary receives 2-acre irrigated land or 4-acre non-irrigated land with 50% subsidy and 50% loan.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen, permanent resident of Maharashtra, aged between 18–60 years, from Scheduled Caste or Nav-Buddhist community, landless, and from a BPL family.
Application Process: Offline: Step 1 – Visit District Social Welfare Office to get application form. Step 2 – Fill form, paste signed photo, attach self-attested documents. Step 3 – Submit to Assistant Commissioner, District Social Welfare Office. Step 4 – Collect receipt/acknowledgment of submission.
Documents Required: BPL Card; Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age (Birth Certificate/Marksheet); 2 Passport Photos (Signed); Residential/Domicile Certificate; Caste Certificate/Neo-Buddhist Certificate; Bank Account Details; Any other document as required.

Scheme Name: Scholarships For Higher Education Abroad To Meritorious Boys And Girls From Open Category
Details: A scheme by the Department of Higher and Technical Education, Government of Maharashtra (launched 4th October 2018) providing scholarships to meritorious open-category students pursuing PG, Diploma, or PhD studies abroad in top-ranked universities.
Benefits: Government pays full tuition fees, full health insurance, living allowance (GBP 9900 for UK / USD 15400 for others), and one-time airfare.
Eligibility: Applicant and parent/guardian must be Indian citizens and Maharashtra residents. Must belong to open category, have an unconditional offer from a QS/THE top 200 ranked university, and family income below ₹8,00,000 per annum.
Application Process: Online: Step 1 – Apply annually at www.dtemaharashtra.gov.in. Step 2 – Register on the portal. Step 3 – Submit application with eligibility proof before the deadline. Step 4 – Directorate of Training verifies and prepares eligible list.
Documents Required: Identity Proof; Domicile Certificate; Income Certificate; Unconditional Offer Letter; Educational Certificates; Passport; No Objection Certificate (if employed).

Scheme Name: LIDCOM Training Scheme
Details: Implemented by Leather Industries Development Corporation (LIDCOM), Govt. of Maharashtra, for Scheduled Caste Charmakar Community students to gain skills for employment or entrepreneurship.
Benefits: Provides free training programs including Footwear Designing (FDDI, UP), UPSC/MPSC preparation, and Smartness Quotient Booster Training.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen, student, Maharashtra resident, aged 18–50, from Charmakar community (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar, Mochi, etc.), with annual family income ≤ ₹1,00,000.
Application Process: Offline: Step 1 – Obtain form from District LIDCOM Office. Step 2 – Fill, attach self-attested documents and photo. Step 3 – Submit to District Office. Step 4 – Collect receipt of submission.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age; 2 Passport Photos; Domicile Certificate; Bonafide Certificate; Income Certificate (Govt. issued); Caste Certificate; Bank Details; Any other document required by LIDCOM.

Scheme Name: Shravanbal Seva State Pension Scheme
Details: A pension scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra, providing ₹600/month to destitute elderly citizens aged 65+ who are permanent residents of Maharashtra.
Benefits: ₹600 per month (₹200 from Indira Gandhi Old Age Pension + ₹400 from Shravanbal Pension) for BPL families; ₹600 per month (entirely state-funded) for non-BPL families with income ≤ ₹21,000.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen, 65+ years, Maharashtra resident for at least 15 years, and either in BPL list or with annual income ≤ ₹21,000.
Application Process: Online/Offline: Register on Aaple Sarkar MahaDBT portal → Verify via OTP → Upload photo, ID, address proof → Apply for the scheme → Receive Application ID and status updates.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 2 Passport Photos; Proof of Age; Income Certificate or BPL Card; Domicile Certificate; Bank Account Details; Any other required documents.

Scheme Name: LIDCOM Margin Money Loan Scheme
Details: A financial support scheme by Leather Industries Development Corporation (LIDCOM), Govt. of Maharashtra, for Scheduled Caste Charmakar community to promote entrepreneurship.
Benefits: For loans ₹50,001–₹5,00,000: 20% project cost as Seed Capital @4% interest, ₹10,000 subsidy, 5% beneficiary contribution, and 75% bank loan repayable in 36–60 months.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen, Maharashtra resident, aged 18–50, from Charmakar community, with family income ≤ ₹1,00,000, and business knowledge.
Application Process: Offline: Step 1 – Collect form from District LIDCOM Office. Step 2 – Fill form, attach documents. Step 3 – Submit to District Office. Step 4 – Collect receipt after submission.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age; 2 Passport Photos; Domicile Certificate; Loan-related proofs; Income Certificate; Caste Certificate; Bank Account Details; Any other document required by LIDCOM.

Scheme Name: Award Of Stipend To VJNT And SBC Students Studying In ITI
Details: A scheme by Government of Maharashtra to encourage VJNT & SBC students pursuing technical education in ITIs by providing a monthly stipend.
Benefits: Maintenance allowance of Rs. 40–100 per month for 10 months.
Eligibility: Students must belong to VJNT or SBC category, be trainees of approved ITI, and have parent/guardian annual income up to ₹65,290. Selection done by ITI Principal.
Application Process: Offline: Submit application to concerned ITI, which forwards it to Asstt. Commissioner, Social Welfare for approval.
Documents Required: Caste Certificate; Domicile Certificate; Residence Proof; Aadhaar Card; Bank Details; School Marksheet; Passport-sized Photograph.

Scheme Name: Grant In Aid To Old Age Home
Details: A scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Maharashtra providing grants to NGOs for accommodating elderly, destitute, and disabled persons in Old Age Homes with food, lodging, boarding, and medical assistance.
Benefits: Grants provided to NGOs for facilities including free lodging, boarding, food, accommodation, and medical assistance for eligible elderly.
Eligibility: Applicant must be a registered NGO, accommodating only old/destitute/disabled persons. Minimum age for men: 60+, for women: 55+. Old persons must be Indian citizens and Maharashtra residents.
Application Process: Offline: Visit District Social Welfare Office, get form, fill with mandatory details, attach self-attested documents, submit to Assistant Commissioner, and collect acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 2 Passport Photos; Residential/Domicile Certificate; Bank Account Details; Proof of Age; Any other document required by District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Opening And Maintenance Of Public School (Vidya Niketan) For Vimukta Jatis And Nomadic Tribes
Details: A Maharashtra government scheme providing grants to voluntary organizations to run public schools (Vidya Niketan) for VJNT students from 5th to 12th standard on merit basis.
Benefits: Financial assistance for building rent, 100% salary grant for staff, free books, notebooks, uniforms, stationery, lodging & boarding; Rs.1450/month per residential student.
Eligibility: Beneficiary must be a student, Maharashtra resident, belong to VJNT community, parent income ≤ Rs.24,000/year, and clear competitive exam for merit admission.
Application Process: Online: Register on Aaple Sarkar/Maha DBT portal, verify OTP, upload documents, fill profile, apply under scheme, save Application ID, track status online.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Proof of Identity; Proof of Age; Proof of Address; Domicile Certificate; Caste Certificate; Latest Educational Marksheet; Fee Receipt; Bank Account Details; Passport-sized Photograph.

Scheme Name: Namo Shetkari Mahasanman Nidhi Yojana
Details: A scheme providing Rs. 6000/year in three installments to PM Kisan eligible farmers families via DBT.
Benefits: Rs.2000 per installment, totaling Rs.12,000/year from PM Kisan & NSMNY combined, credited to Aadhaar-linked bank accounts.
Eligibility: Cultivable landholding farmers (husband, wife, minor children) eligible under PM Kisan as of 01.02.2019. Excludes institutional landholders, high-income categories, retired officers with pension ≥ Rs.10,000, income taxpayers, professionals, and NRIs.
Application Process: Online: Self-registration on PM KISAN portal, eligibility verification, approvals at Taluka/District/State Nodal Officer level (TNO direct registration bypasses approvals).
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 7/12; 8-A; Ferfar; Ration Card; Any other documents as required.

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance for Natural Death
Details: A scheme by Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board providing Rs.2,00,000 to legal heirs of registered workers who die naturally.
Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹2,00,000 to legal heirs.
Eligibility: Applicant must be legal heir of deceased registered construction worker, death must be natural.
Application Process: Offline: Download application from MBOCWW website, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer, acquire receipt.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo; Aadhaar Card; Identity Card of MBOCWW; Bank Passbook; Death Certificate; Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate).

Scheme Name: Term Loan Scheme
Details: A Maharashtra government scheme (funded by NSFDC) to uplift economically disadvantaged members of the Charmakar community, supporting educational, economic, social advancement and production of footwear/leather goods.
Benefits: Term loans ₹1,00,000–₹2,50,000; NSFDC finances 75% of project cost, 20% as seed loan, ₹10,000 subsidy; 5% beneficiary contribution; Interest: 7–8% per annum; Repayment up to 60 months.
Eligibility: Applicant must be Maharashtra resident, belong to Charmakar community, aged 18–50; BPL income criteria; must provide income & caste certificates; knowledge of business required; Income limits for NSFDC: rural < ₹98,000, urban < ₹1,20,000.
Application Process: Offline: Obtain hard copy of application from LIDCOM district office, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to authority, get receipt.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; Caste Certificate; Annual Income Certificate; Ration Card; Passport-size Photos of applicant and spouse; Bank Passbook; Detailed Project Report; Loan Documents.

Scheme Name: Educational Assistance to Children of Registered Worker (11th/12th)
Details: Financial assistance scheme by MBOCWW for children of registered construction workers studying in 11th/12th standard.
Benefits: ₹10,000 per year per child (up to two children per worker, also extends to wife of registered male worker).
Eligibility: Parents/guardians must be registered under MBOCWW; child/wife must be studying in 11th or 12th standard.
Application Process: Offline: Download application from MBOCWW website, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer, get acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo; Aadhaar Card; MBOCWW Identity Card; Bank Passbook; Marksheet for 11th or 12th standard; Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate).

Scheme Name: Educational Assistance for Medical and Engineering Courses
Details: Financial aid scheme by MBOCWW for children/spouse of registered construction workers pursuing medical or engineering degrees.
Benefits: Medical Degree: ₹1,00,000; Engineering Degree: ₹60,000; Maximum two children or spouse eligible.
Eligibility: Parents/guardians registered under MBOCWW; student enrolled in government-recognized medical/engineering institution; max two children/spouse per worker.
Application Process: Offline: Download application from MBOCWW website, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer, get acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo; Aadhaar Card; MBOCWW Identity Card; Bank Passbook; Previous academic level Marksheet/Certificate; Bonafide/Acknowledgment for current academic year; Proof of Residence.

Scheme Name: Educational Assistance for Degree Course
Details: Financial assistance scheme by MBOCWW for children/spouse of registered construction workers pursuing undergraduate degree courses.
Benefits: ₹20,000 per year; Maximum two children and spouse eligible.
Eligibility: Parents/guardians registered under MBOCWW; student enrolled in 1st–4th year degree course; benefit applies to max two children/spouse.
Application Process: Offline: Download application from MBOCWW website, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer, get acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo; Aadhaar Card; MBOCWW Identity Card; Bank Passbook; Previous academic level Marksheet/Certificate; Bonafide/Acknowledgment for current academic year; Proof of Residence.

Scheme Name: Medical Assistance for Treatment of Critical Illness
Details: Financial assistance scheme by MBOCWW for registered construction workers and family members undergoing treatment for serious/critical illnesses.
Benefits: ₹1,00,000 per eligible worker/family member.
Eligibility: Worker must be engaged in construction, registered under MBOCWW; worker/family member must require treatment for serious illness.
Application Process: Offline: Download application from MBOCWW website, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer, get acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo; Aadhaar Card; MBOCWW Identity Card; Bank Passbook; Medical Certificate; Medical Treatment Papers; Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate).

Scheme Name: Educational Assistance to 10th to 12th Students
Details: Financial assistance scheme by MBOCWW for children of registered construction workers scoring 50% or more in 10th or 12th standard exams.
Benefits: ₹10,000 per child for scoring ≥50% in 10th/12th exams.
Eligibility: Parents/guardians registered under MBOCWW; child must have passed 10th/12th with ≥50% marks; only children/spouse of registered workers eligible.
Application Process: Offline: Download application from MBOCWW website, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer, get acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo; Aadhaar Card; MBOCWW Identity Card; Bank Passbook; Marksheet (≥50% marks); Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate).

Scheme Name: Training of Motor Driving to VJNT, SBC & OBC
Details: Government scheme providing light/heavy motor driving and conductor training to needy Vimukta Jati, Nomadic Tribes, OBC & SBC youth, including lodging, boarding, license fees, and stipend.
Benefits: Light Motor Driving: ₹4,264/40 days; Heavy Motor Driving: ₹4,960/40 days; Conductor: ₹1,728/8 days; Stipend: ₹300 (Driver), ₹150 (Conductor) if not local.
Eligibility: Applicant must belong to VJNT, OBC, or SBC; must meet Age, Education, and fitness requirements under Motor Vehicle Act.
Application Process: Online via MahaDBT Portal: Register, login, link Aadhaar to bank, fill profile, select scheme, submit documents, get Application ID, track status.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Proof of Identity; Proof of Age; Proof of Address; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; Caste Certificate; Marksheet of latest qualification; Bank Account Details; Passport-sized Photograph.

Scheme Name: LIDCOM 50% Subsidy Scheme
Details: Subsidy scheme by LIDCOM for Charmakar community to uplift economically weak individuals through loans, providing 50% subsidy up to ₹10,000.
Benefits: 50% of loan amount (max ₹50,000) as subsidy; bank interest as per existing rates.
Eligibility: Citizen of India; permanent Maharashtra resident; aged 18–50; belongs to Charmakar community; annual family income ≤ ₹1,00,000; knowledge of business applied for.
Application Process: Offline: Obtain application from LIDCOM District Office, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to District Office, get acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; Proof of Age; 2 Passport-size Photos; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; Loan-related proofs; Income Certificate; Caste Certificate; Bank Account Details; Any other document required by LIDCOM District Office.

Scheme Name: State Pre-metric Scholarship for Disabled
Details: Scholarship by Dept. of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Maharashtra, to encourage education for students with disability.
Benefits: Class 1–4: ₹100/month; Class 5–7: ₹150/month; Class 8–10: ₹200/month; Mentally Retarded/Ill (≤18 yrs): ₹150/month; Disabled trainees in workshop: ₹300/month.
Eligibility: Citizen of India; Maharashtra resident; enrolled in government-recognized school; Person with Disability ≥40%; must not have failed last qualifying exam; pursuing Class 1–10 or equivalent pre-metric qualification.
Application Process: Offline: Request hard copy from school/college, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit to school/college authority, get acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 2 Passport-size Photos; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; Disability Certificate; Bank Account Details; Proof of latest educational qualification; Bonafide Certificate; Proof of pre-matric pursuance; Any other document required by school/college or District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Matrimonial Incentives
Details: Scheme by Dept. of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Maharashtra, providing financial assistance to PwDs marrying non-disabled persons.
Benefits: Up to ₹50,000: ₹25,000 as saving certificate; ₹20,000 cash; ₹4,500 household utility; ₹500 for attending program.
Eligibility: Citizen of India; Maharashtra resident; Person with Disability ≥40%; married to non-disabled person.
Application Process: Offline: Visit District Social Welfare Office, get application form, fill mandatory fields, attach documents, submit, obtain acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 2 Passport-size Photos; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; Disability Certificate; Bank Account Details; Proof of Age; Proof of Marriage; Any other document required by District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Vasantrao Naik Merit Awards
Details: Merit award by Government of Maharashtra to motivate VJNT students for higher education who came first in State or Board Exams (10th/12th).
Benefits: State First: ₹1,00,000 + Trophy + Certificate; Board First: ₹51,000 + Trophy + Certificate; Separate awards for Boy and Girl.
Eligibility: Student should belong to VJNT category; should be First in State or First in Board Exam; First Boy and Girl eligible.
Application Process: Online via official portal: Register, login, link Aadhaar to bank, fill profile, select scheme, submit documents, get Application ID, track status.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; VJNT/SBC Caste Certificate; Family Income Certificate; Marksheet of 10th/12th Standard.

Scheme Name: Tuition & Examination Fees for VJNT Students
Details: Reimbursement of tuition, admission, term, library, laboratory, gymkhana, and examination fees for Post Matric students belonging to VJNT.
Benefits: All seven fees reimbursed to concerned college/institution.
Eligibility: Student must belong to VJNT; parents' income between ₹1,00,000 – ₹4,50,000; students with one failure and not covered under Govt. of India scholarship are eligible.
Application Process: Online via official portal: Register, login, create profile, apply for eligible schemes, application forwarded by college to Asstt. Commissioner Social Welfare.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; VJNT/SBC Caste Certificate; Family Income Certificate; Marksheet of Latest Qualification; Bank Account Details; Passport-sized Photograph.

Scheme Name: Nanaji Deshmukh Krishi Sanjivani Prakalp
Details: Project by Agriculture Dept., Maharashtra & World Bank to promote climate-resilient agriculture, drought-proofing, water conservation, and adoption of modern techniques.
Benefits: Back-ended subsidies for climate-resilient initiatives, protected cultivation, water conservation, seed production, support to FPOs/SHGs; funds disbursed via Aadhaar-linked DBT.
Eligibility: Farmers' producer companies, registered farmer groups/SHGs, eligible women/landless individuals; Loans > ₹20 lakh require approval; exclusion: landholding >5 ha.
Application Process: Online via DBT portal: Registration, application, pre-sanction by Agriculture officer, work completion, payment request, approval, disbursement to Aadhaar-linked bank account.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Land details (7/12 & 8A extracts); Caste Certificate (SC/ST if applicable); Landless certificate; Death certificate (widows); Divorce certificate (divorcee female).

Scheme Name: Chief Minister Agriculture & Food Processing Scheme
Details: Promotes small and medium agro & food processing units, modern technology adoption, value addition, export promotion, skill development, and employment generation in rural areas.
Benefits: 30% subsidy for construction/machinery (max ₹50 lakh); subsidy paid in two installments post-completion and commercial production; loan 1.5x of subsidy.
Eligibility: Beneficiary age >18, Aadhaar/PAN card, good CIBIL score, 7/12 & 8A certificate or lease documents.
Application Process: Offline: Submit proposal with bank loan approval to District Superintendent Agriculture Officer, feasibility study, verification, in-principle approval, construction, completion, subsidy deposited in bank reserve fund.
Documents Required: Beneficiary Application (Annexure II); Bank Loan Sanction Letter; Bank Appraisal; 7/12 & 8A or Agreement; PAN & Aadhaar; Udyam Registration Certificate; Detailed Project Report; Flow chart of process; Notarized Agreement; Construction Blue Print; Construction Budget; Machinery Quotation; Feasibility Study Report; Recommendation Letter; Audit reports (for upgradation/expansion/modernization projects).

Scheme Name: Bhausaheb Fundkar Falbag Lagvad Scheme
Details: State-sponsored scheme to promote plantation of 16 perennial fruit crops with subsidy via DBT for farmers in Maharashtra.
Benefits: Subsidy for plantation activities: pit digging, grafting/seedlings, fertilizers, crop protection, gap filling; payment via DBT annually for three years.
Eligibility: Permanent resident of Maharashtra; Aadhaar; 7/12 & 8A certificate; institutional beneficiaries excluded.
Application Process: Online via Aaple Sarkar DBT portal: Register, login, complete profile, apply for scheme, pay fees to complete application.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 7/12 Certificate; 8A Certificate; Caste Certificate (SC/ST if applicable); Self Declaration; Pre Sanction Letter; Invoice of Implement.

Scheme Name: State Pre-Metric Scholarship for Disabled
Details: Scholarship by Dept. of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Maharashtra to encourage students with disability (SwDs) to pursue education; fully funded by Govt. of Maharashtra.
Benefits: Class 1-4: ₹100/month; Class 5-7: ₹150/month; Class 8-10: ₹200/month; Mentally Retarded/Mentally Ill (up to 18 yrs): ₹150/month; Disabled trainees in workshops: ₹300/month.
Eligibility: Indian citizen; permanent resident of Maharashtra; student in Govt. recognized school; PwD with ≥40% disability; pursuing pre-metric qualification (Class 1-10); not failed previous exam.
Application Process: Offline: Obtain hard copy of application form from school/college, fill mandatory details, attach documents, submit to school/college authority, obtain acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 2 Passport-sized photos (signed); Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; Disability Certificate; Bank Account details; Latest Educational Qualification proof; Bonafide Certificate; Proof of Pre-metric pursuance; Any other documents required by School/College/District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Matrimonial Incentives for PwD
Details: Financial assistance scheme by Dept. of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Maharashtra to support marriage of PwD to non-disabled person; fully funded by Govt. of Maharashtra.
Benefits: Financial assistance up to ₹50,000: ₹25,000 in saving certificate, ₹20,000 cash, ₹4,500 household utility, ₹500 for attending marriage incentive program.
Eligibility: Indian citizen; permanent resident of Maharashtra; PwD with ≥40% disability; married to non-disabled person.
Application Process: Offline: Obtain hard copy of application form from District Social Welfare Office, fill details, attach documents, submit to office, acquire acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 2 Passport-sized photos (signed); Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; Disability Certificate; Bank Account details; Proof of Age; Proof of Marriage; Any other documents required by District Social Welfare Office.

Scheme Name: Vasantrao Naik Merit Awards
Details: Merit award by Govt. of Maharashtra to motivate VJNT students for higher education who came first in State or Board Exams (10th/12th).
Benefits: State First: ₹1,00,000 + Trophy + Certificate; Board First: ₹51,000 + Trophy + Certificate; Separate awards for Boy and Girl.
Eligibility: Student should belong to VJNT category; should be First in State or Board Exam; First Boy and Girl eligible.
Application Process: Online via official portal: Register, login, link Aadhaar to bank, fill profile, select scheme, submit documents, get Application ID, track status.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; VJNT/SBC Caste Certificate; Family Income Certificate; Marksheet of 10th/12th Standard.

Scheme Name: Tuition & Examination Fees for VJNT Students
Details: Reimbursement of tuition, admission, term, library, laboratory, gymkhana, and examination fees for Post Matric students belonging to VJNT.
Benefits: All seven fees reimbursed to concerned college/institution.
Eligibility: Student must belong to VJNT; parents' income between ₹1,00,000 – ₹4,50,000; students with one failure and not covered under Govt. of India scholarship are eligible.
Application Process: Online via official portal: Register, login, create profile, apply for eligible schemes, application forwarded by college to Asstt. Commissioner Social Welfare.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Maharashtra Domicile Certificate; VJNT/SBC Caste Certificate; Family Income Certificate; Marksheet of Latest Qualification; Bank Account Details; Passport-sized Photograph.

Scheme Name: Nanaji Deshmukh Krishi Sanjivani Prakalp
Details: Project by Agriculture Dept., Maharashtra & World Bank to promote climate-resilient agriculture, drought-proofing, water conservation, and adoption of modern techniques.
Benefits: Back-ended subsidies for climate-resilient initiatives, protected cultivation, water conservation, seed production, support to FPOs/SHGs; funds disbursed via Aadhaar-linked DBT.
Eligibility: Farmers' producer companies, registered farmer groups/SHGs, eligible women/landless individuals; Loans > ₹20 lakh require approval; exclusion: landholding >5 ha.
Application Process: Online via DBT portal: Registration, application, pre-sanction by Agriculture officer, work completion, payment request, approval, disbursement to Aadhaar-linked bank account.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number; Land details (7/12 & 8A extracts); Caste Certificate (SC/ST if applicable); Landless certificate; Death certificate (widows); Divorce certificate (divorcee female).

Scheme Name: Chief Minister Agriculture and Food Processing Scheme
Details: State scheme to promote modern technology-based agro and food processing units, value addition, quality enhancement, export promotion, skill development, and employment generation; implemented since 2017-18, extended till 2026-27.
Benefits: 30% subsidy for construction of factories/machinery up to ₹50 lakh; Credit Linked Back Ended Subsidy in 2 instalments; loan amount ≥1.5 times subsidy.
Eligibility: Age >18; Aadhaar/PAN; Good Bank CIBIL Score; 7/12 & 8-A certificate or lease documents.
Application Process: Offline: Submit proposal with bank loan approval to District Superintendent Agriculture Officer; pre-project feasibility study; District Project Implementation Committee approval; post-completion verification and subsidy release.
Documents Required: Beneficiary Application (Annexure II); Bank Loan Sanction Letter (Original); Bank Appraisal (Original); 7/12 & 8A or Agreement; PAN/Aadhaar; Enterprise Registration Certificate; DPR of project; Flowchart of process; Notarized Agreement (Annexure III); Construction Blue Print & Budget (Bank attested); Machinery Quotation (Bank attested); Pre-project feasibility study report (Annexure-V); Recommendation Letter (Annexure VI); Audit reports (if applicable).

Scheme Name: Bhausaheb Fundkar Falbag Lagvad Scheme
Details: DBT-based subsidy scheme for plantation of 16 perennial fruit crops; launched by Agriculture Dept., Maharashtra (2018-19).
Benefits: Subsidy for pit digging, planting grafts/seedlings, fertilizer application, crop protection, gap filling; DBT credited yearly.
Eligibility: Permanent resident of Maharashtra; Aadhaar; 7/12 & 8-A certificate; exclusions: institutional beneficiaries.
Application Process: Online via https://mahadbt.maharashtra.gov.in/: Register, login, complete profile (personal, address, land details), apply for implements with specifications, pay fees.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 7/12 Certificate; 8-A Certificate; Caste Certificate (SC/ST, if applicable); Self Declaration; Pre Sanction Letter; Invoice of Implement.

Scheme Name: Chief Minister Employment Generation Programme (CMEGP)
Details: State scheme to support unemployed youth, special category, and women in setting up manufacturing, service, agro-based/primary agro processing, E-vehicle, or single-brand service ventures; launched 2019.
Benefits: Subsidy depending on category and location: Urban General 15%, Rural General 25%, Special Category 25%-35%; beneficiary contribution 5%-10%; project cost: manufacturing ≤ ₹50 lakh, service/agro ≤ ₹20 lakh.
Eligibility: Age 18-45 (relaxation +5 years for SC/ST/Women/Differently Abled); unemployed youth; minimum education 7th pass (for projects >₹10 lakh) or 10th pass (for projects >₹25 lakh); male/female; marital status all; annual income: no restriction.
Application Process: Online: Fill application on https://maha-cmegp.gov.in; District Scrutiny by DLSCC; approval by DLTFC; bank sanction and EDP training; subsidy disbursed after 3 years and timely repayment.
Documents Required: Passport size photo; Aadhaar; Domicile certificate; Educational certificate; Undertaking form; Project profile; Caste certificate (if applicable); Special category certificate (if applicable); PAN card; Population certificate (rural only); Bank clearance/approved certificate (if working capital zero for projects >₹5 lakh).

Scheme Name: Swarnima
Details: Loan scheme by Dept. of Social Justice & Special Assistance for OBC women to support self-employment and financial independence; jointly funded by National Backward Classes Finance & Development Corporation and State Corporation.
Benefits: Loan up to ₹5,00,000 per SHG project; ₹25,000 per beneficiary (up to 20 members); funding: 95% central, 5% state; interest 5% per annum; repayment up to 3 years.
Eligibility: Applicant must be OBC; domicile of Maharashtra; age 18-50; family annual income: rural ≤ ₹98,000, urban ≤ ₹1,20,000.
Application Process: Offline: Visit District Office of Leather Industries Development Corporation of Maharashtra (LIDCOM); request hard copy application; fill details; attach documents; submit and get receipt.
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card; 2 Passport Sized Photos (signed); Domicile Certificate; Bank Account Details; Proof of Age; any other documents required by District Office.

Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri - Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana
Details: Women and Child Development Dept., Maharashtra scheme to provide economic support, health, and nutrition benefits to women (21-65 yrs) through DBT.
Benefits: Financial assistance ₹1,500/month.
Eligibility: Female; Maharashtra resident; age 21-65; Aadhaar-linked bank account; family annual income ≤ ₹2,50,000; married/widowed/divorced/abandoned/destitute/unmarried woman in the family; exclusions: family income > ₹2.5 lakh, taxpayer, government employees, MPs/MLAs, four-wheeler owned.
Application Process: Online: Register on official portal; login; fill Aadhaar, bank, permanent address; upload documents; submit and get application ID; track status online.
Documents Required: Photograph of Beneficiary; Aadhaar Card; Domicile Certificate (or alternate: Ration Card, Voter ID, Birth Cert, School Leaving Cert); Income Certificate (if White/No Ration Card); Marriage Certificate (if newly married); Bank Account details; Affirmation Letter.

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance for Widow or Widower of Registered Construction Worker
Details: Implemented by Maharashtra Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Provides financial support to widow or widower in case of death of registered construction worker during employment.
Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹24,000 per annum up to 5 years
Eligibility: Applicant should be widow or widower of deceased construction worker; deceased must be registered with MBOCWW
Application Process: Offline: Download application form from MBOCWW website → Fill all mandatory fields → Submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer → Get receipt/acknowledgment
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo, Aadhaar Card, MBOCWW ID, Bank Passbook, Death Certificate, Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate)

Scheme Name: National Family Benefit Scheme (Maharashtra)
Details: Social welfare scheme by Social Justice & Special Assistance Dept. Provides lump sum financial assistance to BPL family on death of primary breadwinner.
Benefits: One-time financial assistance of ₹20,000
Eligibility: Applicant must be resident of Maharashtra; family member or dependent of deceased breadwinner; family living BPL; deceased aged 18–59
Application Process: Offline: Visit Collector/Tahsildar/Talathi → Request hard copy form → Fill and attach documents → Submit → Get receipt/acknowledgment
Documents Required: Applicant ID (Aadhaar/Voter ID), Deceased ID (Aadhaar), Death Certificate, FIR Copy, Proof of Age of Deceased, BPL/Ration Card, Caste Certificate (if applicable), Address Proof, Bank Passbook, Any other required documents

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance to 75% or Permanent Disability
Details: Launched by MBOCWW, Labor Dept Maharashtra. Financial support for registered construction workers with 75% or more permanent disability.
Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹2,00,000
Eligibility: Worker engaged in construction; registered under MBOCWW; has ≥75% permanent disability
Application Process: Offline: Download application form from MBOCWW website → Fill → Submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer → Get receipt/acknowledgment
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo, Aadhaar Card, MBOCWW ID, Bank Passbook, Disability Certificate, Medical Treatment Payments, Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate)

Scheme Name: Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana (Maharashtra)
Details: Centrally Sponsored Scheme by Social Justice & Special Assistance Dept. Provides insurance and scholarship benefits to landless rural laborers aged 18–59.
Benefits: Natural Death ₹30,000; Accidental Death ₹75,000; Permanent Total Disability ₹75,000; Loss of One/Two Eyes or Limbs ₹37,500–₹75,000; Scholarship ₹100/month per child (max 2)
Eligibility: Maharashtra resident; age 18–59; landless labourer; rural area; family owns no agricultural land; not covered under any other similar insurance scheme
Application Process: Offline: Visit Collector/Tahsildar/Talathi → Request hard copy form → Fill and attach documents → Submit → Get receipt/acknowledgment
Documents Required: Proof of Identity, Proof of Age, Address Proof, Certificate of Landlessness, Passport-Sized Photographs, Income Certificate, Application Form, Self-Attestation, Additional Documents (if applicable)

Scheme Name: First Self Marriage Expenses
Details: Implemented by MBOCWW, Labor Dept Maharashtra. Provides financial assistance for first marriage expenses of registered construction workers.
Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹30,000
Eligibility: Applicant should be engaged in building/construction work; registered under MBOCWW
Application Process: Offline: Download application form from MBOCWW website → Fill all mandatory fields → Submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer → Get receipt/acknowledgment
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo, Aadhaar Card, MBOCWW ID, Bank Passbook, Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate), Marriage Certificate, Affidavit for First Marriage

Scheme Name: Vasantrao Naik Tanda / Basti Development Scheme
Details: Implemented by Social Justice & Special Assistance Dept., Maharashtra. Provides essential amenities to Tandas/Bastis of Vimukta Jatis & Nomadic Tribes, including water, electrification, latrines, drainage, and approach roads.
Benefits: Admissible grant based on VJNT population: 51–100 → 4 Lakhs, 101–150 → 6 Lakhs, Above 151 → 10 Lakhs
Eligibility: Tanda/Basti must have ≥51 VJNT residents; lacking basic amenities; located in Maharashtra
Application Process: Offline: Gram Panchayat representative submits detailed proposal to Block Development Officer → Receipt/acknowledgment → Proposal reviewed by BDO → Forwarded to District Social Welfare Officer → Committee evaluates and sanctions based on eligibility/resources
Documents Required: Detailed Project Proposal, Gram Panchayat Resolution, Population Certificate, Land Ownership/Authorization Certificate, BDO Endorsement, Aadhaar Cards of Gram Panchayat Members, Maharashtra Domicile Certificate, Bank Account Details

Scheme Name: Reimbursement of the MS-CIT Course
Details: Launched by MBOCWW, Labour Dept Maharashtra. Provides reimbursement for MS-CIT course fees for up to two children of registered construction workers.
Benefits: Reimbursement of MS-CIT course fees for up to two children
Eligibility: Parents/guardians must be registered construction workers; child enrolled in government-recognized MS-CIT course
Application Process: Offline: Download application form from MBOCWW website → Fill → Submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer → Get receipt/acknowledgment
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo, Aadhaar Card, MBOCWW ID, Bank Passbook, MS-CIT Passed Certificate, Fee Receipt, Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate)

Scheme Name: Dr. Panjabrao Deshmukh Hostel Maintenance Allowance
Details: Welfare scheme by Government of Maharashtra providing financial assistance for tuition fees, examination fees, and other related expenses to students from economically weaker sections.
Benefits: Hostel maintenance allowance: Income <8 L → Mumbai/Pune/Nagpur/Aurangabad Rs.3000/year, others Rs.2000/year; For registered labourers Rs.30,000/year (Metro) & Rs.20,000/year (others)
Eligibility: Indian nationality; Maharashtra domicile; bonafide student of professional/technical course (Diploma/Graduation/Post Graduation); admitted through CAP; not receiving other scholarship; max 2 children per family; total annual family income ≤8 L; minimum 50% attendance; no course gap >2 years
Application Process: Online: Register at https://mahadbt.maharashtra.gov.in → Login → Find eligible scheme → Apply for Dr. Panjabrao Deshmukh Hostel Maintenance Allowance
Documents Required: Domicile Certificate, HSC & SSC Marksheet, Income Certificate of Parents, Previous Year Marksheet, Affidavit, Proof of Registered Labourer (if applicable), Aadhaar Card, Student PAN, Parents PAN

Scheme Name: LIDCOM Education Loan Scheme
Details: Implemented by Leather Industries Development Corporation (LIDCOM), Maharashtra. Provides education loans for post graduate students from Charmakar Community for studies in India and abroad.
Benefits: Education Loan: Up to ₹10,00,000 for India, Up to ₹20,00,000 for abroad; Interest Rate: Male 4% p.a., Female 3.5% p.a.
Eligibility: Indian citizen; permanent resident of Maharashtra; from Charmakar Community (Dhor, Chambhar, Holar, Mochi etc.); age 18–50; family income ≤3,00,000; knowledge of intended business/field
Application Process: Offline: Obtain application form from LIDCOM District Office → Fill and attach self-attested documents → Submit to District Office → Receive acknowledgment
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card, 2 Passport Sized Photographs, Marksheet of Latest Qualification, Proof of Admission (Offer Letter), Residential/Domicile Certificate, Income Certificate, Caste Certificate, Bank Account Details, Previous Loan Statement (if any)

Scheme Name: Savitribai Phule Scholarship For V.J.N.T and S.B.C Girls Students Studying In 8th To 10th Std
Details: Scholarship by Social Justice & Special Assistance Dept., Maharashtra. Encourages enrollment and reduces dropout ratio of VJNT/SBC girls in 8th–10th standards.
Benefits: ₹100 per month for 10 months (₹1,000/year)
Eligibility: Girl student belonging to VJNT or SBC; studying in 8th–10th standard; no income/marks limit
Application Process: Online: Visit https://mahadbt.maharashtra.gov.in → New Applicant Registration → Login → Link Aadhaar → Fill Profile → Apply for Savitribai Phule Scholarship → Submit → Save Application ID
Documents Required: Aadhaar Number, Proof of Identity, Proof of Age (Birth Certificate), Proof of Address, Maharashtra Domicile Certificate, Caste Certificate (VJNT/SBC), Latest Marksheet, Current Course Fee Receipt, Bank Account Details, Passport-sized Photograph

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance to 75% or Permanent Disability
Details: Launched by MBOCWW, Labour Dept Maharashtra. Provides financial assistance to registered construction workers with 75% or more permanent disability (benefit after 26th July 2014).
Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹2,00,000 to registered worker with 75% or more permanent disability.
Eligibility: Worker engaged in building/construction work; registered under MBOCWW; has 75% or permanent disability.
Application Process: Offline: Download application form from MBOCWW → Fill and attach documents → Submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer → Get receipt/acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo, Aadhaar Card, MBOCWW Identity Card, Bank Passbook, Disability Certificate (competent medical officer/board), Medical Treatment Payments, Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate)

Scheme Name: Aam Aadmi Bima Yojana (Maharashtra)
Details: Implemented by Social Justice & Special Assistance Dept., Maharashtra. Centrally Sponsored Scheme providing insurance and scholarship benefits to landless rural labourers aged 18–59 years. Annual premium ₹200 with 50% subsidy by State & Central Govt.
Benefits: Natural Death: ₹30,000; Accidental Death: ₹75,000; Permanent Total Disability: ₹75,000; Loss of Two Eyes/Two Limbs: ₹75,000; Loss of One Eye/One Limb: ₹37,500; Scholarship: ₹100/month for up to 2 children (9th–12th standard).
Eligibility: Resident of Maharashtra; age 18–59; landless labourer; residing in rural area; family should not own agricultural land; not covered under other similar insurance.
Application Process: Offline: Obtain application form from Office of Collector/Tahsildar/Talathi → Fill and attach documents → Submit within prescribed period → Get receipt/acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Proof of Identity, Proof of Age, Address Proof, Certificate of Landlessness, Passport-sized Photographs, Income Certificate, Application Form, Self-Attestation, Additional Documents (if applicable)

Scheme Name: First Self Marriage Expenses
Details: Implemented by MBOCWW, Labour Dept Maharashtra. Provides financial assistance for first marriage expenses of registered construction workers.
Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹30,000 for first marriage expenses.
Eligibility: Engaged in building/construction work; registered under MBOCWW.
Application Process: Offline: Download application form from MBOCWW → Fill and attach documents → Submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer → Get receipt/acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo, Aadhaar Card, MBOCWW Identity Card, Bank Passbook, Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate), Marriage Certificate, Affidavit for First Marriage

Scheme Name: Vasantrao Naik Tanda/Basti Development Scheme
Details: Implemented by Dept. of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Maharashtra. Provides essential amenities to Tandas/Bastis of Vimukta Jatis and Nomadic Tribes (VJNT), improving access to drinking water, electrification, latrines, drainage, and approach roads.
Benefits: Admissible grant based on population: 51–100 → ₹4 Lakhs, 101–150 → ₹6 Lakhs, Above 151 → ₹10 Lakhs.
Eligibility: Tanda/Basti with ≥51 VJNT residents; area lacking basic infrastructure; located in Maharashtra.
Application Process: Offline: Gram Panchayat submits detailed proposal to Block Development Officer → Reviewed → Forwarded to District Social Welfare Officer → Evaluated by committee → Final sanction based on eligibility and resources.
Documents Required: Detailed Project Proposal, Gram Panchayat Resolution, Population Certificate, Land Ownership/Authorization Certificate (if applicable), Endorsement from BDO, Aadhaar Cards of Gram Panchayat Members, Maharashtra domicile certificate, Bank Account Details

Scheme Name: Reimbursement of the MS-CIT Course
Details: Launched by MBOCWW, Labour Dept Maharashtra. Reimbursement of MS-CIT course fees for up to two children of registered construction workers.
Benefits: Reimbursement of MS-CIT course fees for up to 2 children of registered construction workers.
Eligibility: Children’s parents/guardians should be registered construction workers; construction worker registered under MBOCWW; applicant enrolled in government-recognized MS-CIT course.
Application Process: Offline: Download application form from MBOCWW → Fill and attach documents → Submit to Labor Commissioner/Government Labor Officer → Get receipt/acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Passport-size Photo, Aadhaar Card, MBOCWW Identity Card, Bank Passbook, MS-CIT Passed Certificate, Fee Receipt, Proof of Residence (Aadhaar/Passport/Driving Licence/Ration Sheet/Electricity Bill/Gram Panchayat Certificate)

Scheme Name: Gopinath Munde Shetkari Apghat Suraksha Sanugrah Audhan Yojana
Details: Provides compensation to farmers or their family members in case of accidents resulting in death or disability.
Benefits: Death: ₹2,00,000; Disablement: ₹1,00,000/₹2,00,000 depending on type (loss of limb/eye)
Eligibility: Registered farmers aged 10–75; person registered as farmer in Maharashtra evidenced by 7/12 extract; family member of registered farmer
Application Process: Offline: Submit claim proposal with documents to Taluka Agriculture Officer within 30 days → Team visits and reports to Tehsildar within 8 days → Taluka Agriculture Officer scrutinizes and forwards → Committee decision within 30 days → Funds transferred via ECS
Documents Required: 7/12 Extract, Village form No. 6-D (Fer-far), Village form No. 6-C, Age proof (birth certificate/School leaving certificate), Death certificate, FIR, Inquest Report/Panchnama, Post-Mortem Report/Panchnama, Viscera Report, Disability Certificate

Scheme Name: Sanjay Gandhi Niradhar Grant Scheme
Details: Financial assistance scheme for destitute, orphan, PwD, transgender, widows, and other vulnerable groups in Maharashtra. Funded 100% by the state government.
Benefits: ₹600/month for one beneficiary; ₹900/month for more than one beneficiary in eligible family
Eligibility: Citizen of India; permanent resident of Maharashtra; BPL or annual income ≤ ₹21,000; belongs to eligible categories (Destitute, Orphan, PwD, Transgender, Widows, etc.)
Application Process: Offline/Online: Obtain application form from Collector/Tahsildar/Talathi → Fill and attach documents → Submit to authority → Receive receipt/acknowledgment
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card, 2 Passport-sized Photographs, Residential/Domicile Certificate, Bank Account Details, Medical Certificate/Certificate of Incapacity, Proof of Age, Income Certificate/BPL Card, Disability Certificate, Transgender Certificate (if applicable), Marriage/Death Certificate (if applicable)

Scheme Name: Mahatma Jyotirao Phule Jan Arogya Yojana
Details: Provides cashless secondary and tertiary medical services through empaneled hospitals in Maharashtra. Coverage now up to ₹1.5 lakh under MJPJAY and ₹5 lakh under Ayushman Bharat.
Benefits: Health coverage: ₹5 lakh/family/year (Categories A-E, excluding D); ₹1 lakh/person/year (Category D); Cashless hospitalization, diagnostics, medical expenses, transport costs, follow-up treatment
Eligibility: Category-based eligibility: A (AAY/Annapurna/Orange card), B (White ration card or domicile certificate), C (students, orphanages, women's ashrams, seniors, journalists, construction workers), D (road accident victims from outside), E (border villages' families with specific ration cards)
Application Process: Offline: Visit any network hospital → Request application form → Fill and attach documents → Submit → Get receipt/acknowledgment; Claim settlements managed via SHAS portal
Documents Required: Aadhaar or Aadhaar registration slip with photo, PAN Card, Voter ID, Driving License, School/College ID, Passport, Freedom Fighter ID, Health Card (RGJAY/MJPJAY), Handicap Certificate, Bank Passbook with Photo, Senior Citizen Card, Defense Ex-Servicemen Card, Marine Fishery Identity Card, Any Govt-issued photo ID

Scheme Name: Shahu, Phule, Ambedkar Award
Details: Award for registered organizations working in social justice and social reforms in Maharashtra. 100% state-funded.
Benefits: Prize: ₹15,00,000 + Memento + Silver Krol Citation; 7 awards for 7 regions
Eligibility: Institutions/organizations located in Maharashtra; working in social justice; at least 15 years of social service in Maharashtra
Application Process: Offline: Visit District Social Welfare Office → Obtain application form → Fill and attach documents → Submit to Assistant Commissioner → Receive receipt/acknowledgment
Documents Required: Proof of Registration of Organization/Institute, Proof of 15+ years social service, Character Verification Report for President and Secretary, Bank Account Details, Any other document required by District Social Welfare Office

Scheme Name: Group Supply of Goats and Sheep
Details: Collective livestock supply scheme for small-scale farmers to improve market access and income in Maharashtra. Focus on ST and BPL farmers.
Benefits: Tribal beneficiaries receive group of 10 goats + 1 buck at 50% subsidy; Supply of goat units for income & employment generation
Eligibility: Beneficiary should belong to Scheduled Tribe; Beneficiary should be below poverty line
Application Process: Offline: Connect with Group Development Officer under Panchayat Samiti/Zilla Parishad
Documents Required: Aadhaar Card, Caste Certificate, Income Certificate

Scheme Name: Karmaveer Padmashri Dadasaheb Gaikwad Birth Centenary And Prize Distribution
Details: Award by Dept. of Social Justice, Maharashtra, for individuals/organizations working against untouchability and for landless farm workers. Only permanent residents of Maharashtra are eligible.
Benefits: ₹51,000 along with memorabilia, shawl, and coconut.
Eligibility: - Done social movement work - From Social Welfare Sector/Institute, registered - Social service ≥ 15 years - Male ≥ 50 yrs, Female ≥ 40 yrs - Indian citizen, permanent resident of Maharashtra
Application Process: Offline: Obtain application from District Social Welfare Office → Fill form, attach photograph and documents → Submit to Assistant Commissioner → Acquire acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Proof of work experience, Proof of registration, Character verification, Aadhaar, Proof of age, 2 passport photos, Residential/Domicile certificate, Caste certificate, Bank account details, Any other required documents

Scheme Name: Providing Mini Tractor and its Sub Parts to the Self Help Group of Scheduled Castes
Details: Scheme by Dept. of Social Justice, Maharashtra, providing mini tractors and sub-parts to SHGs of SC/Nav-Buddhists to improve financial condition.
Benefits: Mini tractor & sub-parts worth ₹3,50,000; SHG contributes 10% (₹35,000), Govt provides 90% subsidy (₹3,15,000).
Eligibility: - Belong to SC or Nav-Buddhist - Maharashtra domicile - SHG ≥ 80% SC/Nav-Buddhist members - SHG contributes 10% of cost
Application Process: Offline: Obtain application from District Social Welfare Office → Fill form, attach photograph and documents → Submit to Assistant Commissioner → Acquire acknowledgment.
Documents Required: Identity proof of SHG members, Domicile certificate, Caste certificates, SHG registration certificate, Bank account details, Affidavit for ≥80% SC/Nav-Buddhist, Proposal letter, Cost estimate

Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Yuva Karya Prashikshan Yojana
Details: Launched by Dept. of Skill, Employment, Maharashtra, to enhance employability through 6-month practical training with entrepreneurs; targets ~10 lakh candidates/year.
Benefits: Stipend: 12th Pass: ₹6,000; ITI/Diploma: ₹8,000; Degree/Post Graduation: ₹10,000 (direct transfer to Aadhaar-linked bank account).
Eligibility: - Maharashtra resident - Age 18–35 - Education: 12th/ITI/Diploma/Graduation/Post Graduation - Aadhaar registered with linked bank account
Application Process: Online: Register on CMYKPY portal → Complete profile, upload documents → Submit and apply for job training.
Documents Required: Passport-size photograph, Aadhaar card, Bank passbook/cancelled cheque, Living certificate, Birth certificate, Education certificates, Domicile certificate/SSC certificate

Scheme Name: Long Term-Loan to SC Co-op Spinning Mills under Special Component Plan
Details: Promotes development of SC-owned spinning mills by providing loan covering 50% of project cost.
Benefits: Loan covers 50% of project cost.
Eligibility: - Collect ≥ ₹80,00,000 or ≥5% of project cost as member shares - Project enumerated by recognized financial institutions
Application Process: Offline: Obtain application from Textile Dept. → Fill form, attach photograph/documents → Submit to Textile Dept. → Submit to Assistant Commissioner for sanction
Documents Required: Passport-sized photograph, Recent financial statements, Project report by recognized institution, Identity & address proof, Prior approvals from Textile Dept., Any other required documents
